result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob A Raglin

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jacob A Raglin in court.  Attorney Jason Mitchel Daane in court for Jacob A Raglin.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 3:56 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for arraignment on both files - 22CF265 & 22CF377. Record by Atty. Daane who enters not guilty pleas on behalf of the defendant, reserves all rights and asks for a status. Court sets out 90 days.
Status conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in court with attorney Jason Daane. ADA Herrmann appears for the State of Wisconsin. Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing on 22CF265 but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing; 22CF377 is set for an Initial appearance and is waiving preliminary hearing as well. Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. State asking for 30 days for ARGN.
Arraignment scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jacob A Raglin in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Jason Mitchel Daane in court for Jacob A Raglin. Rights given and preliminary hearing requested within time period. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Signature bond filed. Defendant refused to sign.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
BOND TO COVER 22GF697 & 22CF265

DEFENDANT MUST POST $500 CASH

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH S.T. dob 3-4-1989 OR RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 

22-3114 thru 3116

Case called at 1:45 PM. Defendant Jacob A Raglin in court, in custody by video. JJ Crawford for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Daane appears specially. Record by State who asks that prior bond be forfeited in 22CF265 and new bond be set. Argument. Court sets bond at $500 cash. Minutes filed.

The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH S.T. dob 3-4-1989 OR RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 

22-3114 thru 3116
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jacob A Raglin in court. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Minutes filed.
